image.altText: A man in an orange t-shirt with his hands behind his back and police officers either side of him.

props.synopsis: The man suspected of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump camped outside a golf course with food and a rifle for nearly 12 hours before he was spotted by the Secret Service, according to court documents.

title.children: Ryan Routh charged with gun crimes after apparent Florida assassination attempt on Donald Trump

image.altText: Alleged would-be Trump shooter Ryan Routh

props.synopsis: An investigation into the digital footprint of Donald Trump's alleged would-be assassin Ryan Routh paints a vivid and contradictory picture of his mindset.

title.children: 'You were my choice in [2016]': Trump's alleged would-be assassin's peculiar political leanings

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: An announcement that 13,700 new homes will be supported through the government's flagship housing fund has come before details have been finalised.

title.children: Federal government unaware on size of social housing spend, with some projects set to take years

image.altText: Composite image of Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping

props.synopsis: The Russian and Chinese economies are lurching into ever more perilous territory, threatening the nations' alliance.

title.children: Isolated on the world stage, Russia turned to China. Now it's suffering from a power imbalance

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch and Elena Zhukova Murdoch hold hands as they walk away from a car.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch, his feuding sons and their sisters travel to Nevada for a court hearing over the future of the family's media empire.

title.children: Rupert Murdoch and his warring children take their family feud to court

image.altText: a pastoralist wearing a red collared shirt with his arms crossed in front of a level crossing

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory pastoralist has called for safety upgrades to an outback railway crossing where a cattle truck collided with The Ghan tourist train on Sunday, saying it's a "dangerous spot".

title.children: Pastoralist calls for upgrades at 'dangerous' rail crossing where cattle truck struck The Ghan

image.altText: A sculpture of a face and head with red lips and the skill absent showing the outline of a brain

props.synopsis: Many of the risk factors for dementia – being female, growing older and the genetic lottery — cannot be avoided. But research is uncovering a growing list of ways to cut your risk.

title.children: The 14 risk factors to watch for as dementia cases set to skyrocket

image.altText: A man wearing a suit, standing in an office.

props.synopsis: Business Council of Australia chief executive Bran Black, who represents some of the country's biggest employers, says the government's recent industrial relations reform is leading businesses to invest overseas.

title.children: Business Council chief to criticise Albanese over workplace changes

image.altText: A composite image featuring various aspects of her case, including courtroom sketches.

props.synopsis: When the young woman vanished, police stumbled across what they believed to be a sinister plot to take her baby boy. But despite a lengthy murder trial, what happened to her remains one of regional Australia's enduring mysteries.

title.children: Allegations of forced surrogacies, tied-up schoolgirls: How Amber Haigh's disappearance brought ominous rumours into the limelight

image.altText: Three ducks stand in snow

props.synopsis: Temperatures across south-east Australia have plummeted during the past 48 hours, leading to the coldest spring weather in decades.

title.children: Record spring cold snap delivers snow and severe frost to south-east Australia

image.altText: A village next to a mine

props.synopsis: Local officials say an influx of weapons into the remote highlands has exacerbated the violence between rival groups.

title.children: At least 30 people killed in tribal violence in Papua New Guinea's remote highlands

image.altText: Young Indian woman wearing a grey shirt.

props.synopsis: Indian students make up the second-largest group of international students in Australia, but opportunistic agents are scamming students out of hundreds of thousands of dollars.

title.children: Scores of Indian families fall victim to multi-million-dollar Australian visa fraud

image.altText: A woman seated in a laboratory wearing a yellow jacket.

props.synopsis: Labor and the Greens are still hashing out whether to include a "climate trigger" that would see proposed resources projects barred if they emit too much atmospheric pollution in the Environmental Protection Authority legislation.

title.children: Albanese rules out 'climate trigger' in nature reforms, but leaves door open for 'climate consideration' compromise

image.altText: An Indigenous man stands in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: Over almost 20 years, Indigenous leader Geoff Clark siphoned about $1 million from his community. Here's how the police finally caught him in a story only now able to be told.

title.children: How Operation Omega brought down former ATSIC head Geoff Clark

image.altText: a woman with sunglasses on her head holds a funeral booklet

props.synopsis: Tracey Paton watched her son wave goodbye on a hot summer's day as he promised to be home by lunchtime. A car crash later claimed his life.

title.children: After 24 surgeries and months in hospital, Tracey's 15-year-old son died from serious injuries sustained in a car crash

image.altText: Portrait of a man in his moody apartment.

props.synopsis: Boarding house owners' change to their business model suggest the laws protecting the rights of residents are not working.

title.children: How 'renovictions' are pricing out long-term residents of Sydney's affordable housing

image.altText: Tam  Ghazarian  2024-09-07 10:09:00

props.synopsis: King Island, off the north west of Tasmania, is a resilient, tight-knit community. But the impending closure of the community's largest employer means many are being forced to reconsider their future.

title.children: Living on this remote Bass Strait Island has always come with its challenges. Now, it's been dealt another blow

image.altText: Exposed timber beams inside a house which is under construction.

props.synopsis: It's not just Australian home owners who are being left to struggle as large numbers of builders go bust. Contractors, too, are facing hefty losses.

title.children: 'Big red flags': This couple have been left with an incomplete house after their builder went bust

image.altText: A collage of photos shows different weather conditions across Queensland towns and cities.

props.synopsis: The chilly temperatures Queensland has been experiencing this week are a stark difference to the warmer days the state saw earlier.

title.children: Parts of Queensland record coldest September morning in 10 years

image.altText: Charlotte Wood, a 59-year-old woman with cropped grey hair, smiles, while standing in a well-lit doorway.

props.synopsis: Charlotte Wood is shortlisted for her 10th book, Stone Yard Devotional, a novel about a woman who leaves her life in the city to join an enclosed religious community.

title.children: Charlotte Wood becomes first Australian shortlisted for $100k Booker Prize in decade

image.altText: Three female boccia players and their ramp assistants pose with medals on the podium.

props.synopsis: Australia's two greatest boccia players delivered Australia's best-ever result in the sport at the Paris Paralympics. With increased grassroots participation and a widened audience, a more inclusive sporting future beckons.

title.children: Australia's Paralympic boccia success points to more inclusive sporting future

image.altText: a woman with sunglasses on her head holds a funeral booklet

props.synopsis: Tracey Paton watched her son wave goodbye on a hot summer's day as he promised to be home by lunchtime. A car crash later claimed his life.

title.children: After 24 surgeries and months in hospital, Tracey's 15-year-old son died from serious injuries sustained in a car crash

image.altText: A firefighter stands in a street looking on at strewn bits of metal and a tree that has come down in a storm

props.synopsis: Typhoon Bebinca has battered China's biggest city, with the clean-up effort now underway.

title.children: Strongest typhoon in more than 75 years hits Shanghai leaving tens of thousands without power

image.altText: Woman with curly brown hair with red streaks smiles with closed mouth. She wears pink jumper and is seen from shoulders up.

props.synopsis: A growing number of people care for their elderly or ill parent, while also raising young children. It can be stressful and isolating, but self-care and setting boundaries can help.

title.children: Do you have kids, care for a parent and work? You're in the 'sandwich generation'. Here's some advice

image.altText: Mahli Beardman smiles while holding his player of the match medal after a game

props.synopsis: Australia adds teenager Mahli Beardman to its touring party for the ODIs against England, with the quick on stand-by to play in the five-match series.

title.children: Australia flies unknown teenager into squad for England ODIs to boost depleted pace stocks

image.altText: A man with an angry expression looks on

props.synopsis: The former long-time face of the BBC's flagship news program, who announced Queen Elizabeth's death on air in 2022, is given a suspended sentence at a London court on Monday after admitting to making indecent images of children.

title.children: Former BBC presenter Huw Edwards avoids jail over making indecent images of children

image.altText: A man sits with glasses on

props.synopsis: Tito Jackson, the third of nine Jackson children, including global superstars Michael and Janet, has died.

title.children: Tito Jackson, member of The Jackson 5, dies aged 70

image.altText: A man leans down and works on a garden bed

props.synopsis: Les Stephson is not letting his age get in the way of maintaining his "pride and joy" — his garden, where he goes to remember his wife who died a year ago.

title.children: 95-year-old keeps garden dream alive as flower festival gets underway after beloved wife's passing

image.altText: 2 Little Green Island

props.synopsis: British-American movie producer and actor Douglas Gresham sells Little Green Island to a North Queensland family, putting it back in Australian hands.

title.children: Australian island that inspired the Narnia movies sells at auction for $5.6 million

image.altText: a pastoralist wearing a red collared shirt with his arms crossed in front of a level crossing

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory pastoralist has called for safety upgrades to an outback railway crossing where a cattle truck collided with The Ghan tourist train on Sunday, saying it's a "dangerous spot".

title.children: Pastoralist calls for upgrades at 'dangerous' rail crossing where cattle truck struck The Ghan

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: The defence lawyer for independent MP Troy Bell says the case against the politician is "misguided and misleading".

title.children: Fraud case against MP has 'more holes than a Balfours crumpet', defence lawyer says

image.altText: A group of older high school students ar work in a classroom.

props.synopsis: A NSW Catholic high school will allow senior students to learn from home one day a week permanently following a trial that found the program helped students become more independent despite concerns about a lack of structure.

title.children: Private school adopts four-day week permanently after successful trial

image.altText: An actress stands on stage in a black dress holding an Emmy statue at a microphone

props.synopsis: Australian actress Elizabeth Debicki has won an Emmy for her role as Princess Diana in The Crown. This and other highlights from the 76th Emmy awards.

title.children: Elizabeth Debicki wins Emmy for playing Princess Diana in The Crown
